>
> Worth a perma ban? not even close.

The ban system does not care if a single instance is worth a permanent ban unless it is applying a permanent ban on a first offense, which almost never happens. What it looks for is Improvement of behavior after a player has been warned that their behavior is not acceptable. Even repeated and persistent minor toxicity will eventually earn a permanent ban if the player does not take steps to reform their behavior.

In short, a permanent ban is not reserved for only the worst of the worst in terms of the type of toxicity that is used. It is reserved for anyone who proves to be a repeated toxic influence on the game community and shows no inclination towards changing that.

If you want to have a dicsussion about whether or not the system is too loose in its definition of toxicity that's fine, but it's not an argument I want to derail this thread with. :)
